tool.name: SAGA.statistics_regression.15
tool.description: Zonal Multiple Regression Analysis (Points and Predictor Grids)
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPREDICTORS True isArrayZONES False isArrayPOINTS False isArrayATTRIBUTE False output_data_RESIDUALS $output_data_RESIDUALS output_data_REGRESSION $output_data_REGRESSION name SAGA.statistics_regression.15 PREDICTORS $PREDICTORS ZONES $ZONES POINTS $POINTS ATTRIBUTE $ATTRIBUTE RESAMPLING $RESAMPLING COORD_X $COORD_X COORD_Y $COORD_Y INTERCEPT $INTERCEPT METHOD $METHOD P_VALUE $P_VALUE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_RESIDUALS $OutputSection_RESIDUALS.outputType_RESIDUALS transmissionMode_RESIDUALS $OutputSection_RESIDUALS.transmissionMode_RESIDUALS outputType_REGRESSION $OutputSection_REGRESSION.outputType_REGRESSION transmissionMode_REGRESSION $OutputSection_REGRESSION.transmissionMode_REGRESSION

param.name: PREDICTORS
param.label: Predictors
param.help: Predictors The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, tiff

param.name: ZONES
param.label: Zones
param.help: Zones The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: ATTRIBUTE
param.label: Dependent Variable
param.help: Dependent Variable The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: P_VALUE
param.label: Significance Level
param.help: Significance level (aka p-value) as threshold for automated predictor selection, given as percentage

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_RESIDUALS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_REGRESSION
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Linear regression analysis of point attributes using multiple predictor grids. Details of the regression/correlation analysis will be saved to a table. The regression function is used to create a new grid with regression based values. The multiple regression analysis uses a forward selection procedure. Each polygon in the zones layer is processed as individual zone. <br/>Reference:<br/>- Bahrenberg, G., Giese, E., Nipper, J. (1992): 'Statistische Methoden in der Geographie 2 - Multivariate Statistik', Stuttgart, 415p.<br/>
